nodes.bodyText:
@mpirvu The includes in this file have some weird issues:

If I uncomment #if defined(J9VM_OPT_JITSERVER), then the code compiles but it compiles as if the environment variable is not set, i.e. none of the jitserver code in this file is compiled.
If I move PersistentInfo include to the top of the file, then compilation fails with ‘getRemoteCompilationMode’ was not declared in this scope message despite it being declared in J9PersistentInfo.hpp.

I don't know what might be causing this as I think I modified make/cmake files correctly and everything else compiles without problems. This problem persists when I build a clean OpenJ9 sdk so it's not a stale build issue.

nodes.bodyText:
From my diagnostic, even for other files J9VM_OPT_JITSERVER is not defined. What defines it is j9cfg.h, so we need to include this header file in all files that use JITServer code.
In most of the places it works because we include a header which includes another header, etc, which includes j9cfg.h

nodes.bodyText:
Well PersistentInfo.hpp includes J9PersistentInfo.hpp so that should be fine.
In all other instances of this include non-J9 version is used so I used it here as well.
Changing it to J9 doesn't seem to have any effect.

nodes.bodyText: I don't see where this monitor is used.
Fixed.
Maybe we should give a different name to this function because there is another classMapMonitor in the client session and it can be confusing
Changed to chTableMonitor
clearCaches() must clear the CHTable as well.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -501,14 +507,6 @@ ClientSessionData::clearCaches()
 
    _classChainDataMap.clear();

nodes.bodyText:
I clear the CHTable in ClientSessionData destructor, since it was previously cleared there.
I will move it to clearCaches() if you'd prefer that.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -501,14 +507,6 @@ ClientSessionData::clearCaches()
 
    _classChainDataMap.clear();

nodes.bodyText: In case some message gets lost we have to clear all caches and start all over because that message may have carried important class unload and CHTable modification that needs to be applied. The client session data is not destroyed, just the caches are cleared, including the CHTable.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -501,14 +507,6 @@ ClientSessionData::clearCaches()
 
    _classChainDataMap.clear();

nodes.bodyText: We need the acquire the new monitor that was created for the CHTable per client

Yeah, this is an unexpected error. I first had the CH table monitor in client session but then I realized that it's better to have it inside server-side CH-table and moved it there. But I also changed the name from _classTableMonitor to _classMapMonitor without realizing that the monitor with such name already exists.
We need the release the new monitor that was created for the CHTable per client

We can forward declare class JITServerPersistentCHTable and avoid this include.
We may need an include in the cpp file though
Done
I wonder I should we do if the monitor cannot be initialized. Maybe throw bad_alloc as if we couldn't allocate the memory.

-   : TR_PersistentCHTable(trMemory)
+   : TR_PersistentCHTable(trMemory),
+   _classMap(decltype(_classMap)::allocator_type(TR::Compiler->persistentAllocator()))
    {
+   _chTableMonitor = TR::Monitor::create("JIT-JITServerCHTableMonitor");

nodes.bodyText: Probably.
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -31,14 +31,23 @@
 
 
 JITServerPersistentCHTable::JITServerPersistentCHTable(TR_PersistentMemory *trMemory)
-   : TR_PersistentCHTable(trMemory)
+   : TR_PersistentCHTable(trMemory),
+   _classMap(decltype(_classMap)::allocator_type(TR::Compiler->persistentAllocator()))
    {
+   _chTableMonitor = TR::Monitor::create("JIT-JITServerCHTableMonitor");

nodes.bodyText: We need to set the _chTable to NULL after freeing it. The session may continue to live even after caches are cleared.
Fixed
